page.text: 222 E 17th Street, Apt: 3C, Brooklyn, NY 11226 | (646) 441 8227 | en36321n@pace.edu
An ambitious and hardworking graduate with a strong academic and internship background in financial services.
Successfully supported a wide range of accounting, trading and financial analysis/planning operations for a wide range of
organizations. Strengthened communication, team building and adaptability skills. Experience in developing tools using
Access, VBA, and Excel. Certified in Bloomberg Essentials and Market Concepts. Fluent in Turkish, conversant in
Spanish.
Technical Skills: Morningstar, Bloomberg and Envestnet. Data Analytics: Stata
Pace University, New York, NY Expected 12/2015
Bachelor of Business Administration in Finance with minor in Accounting and Economics, GPA: 3.25
New York, NY
Investment Banking Analyst Intern
10/2015-Present
Perform financial and operational due diligence on biotech and technology companies by analyzing performance
metrics, market trends, competition, and company management.
Attend quarterly earnings conference calls and wrote reports on companies’ financial performance for the
management.
Designed all company marketing materials including PowerPoint presentations, transaction summaries, new deal
snapshots, and website materials.
New York, NY
Equity Research Intern
Analyzed third party industry and company reports and created multi source summary reports which were
distributed to AGCO, its worldwide partner network, and its emerging market institutional client-base.
Improved the company wide research process by creating a firm standard format for research reports. This
standard was adopted for uses in 128 markets across the world resulting in a simplified search for key financial
data from various platforms; such as Bloomberg, Capital IQ, and Reuters.
Assembled, collected, and analyzed, financial data and valuation metrics via Bloomberg for the production of
company equity research reports.
Analyzed client profiles using Ipreo a customer relationship management platform, to identify AGCO’s clients’
previous holdings and expected sales pressure points.
Northwestern Mutual Financial Network–ss Cannataro Park Avenue Financial New York, NY
Wealth Management Intern 03/2014 – 06/2014
Generated over $100k in revenue by troubleshooting unlinked client accounts.
Performed asset allocation based on established client risk tolerance and cash requirements, and determined
whether changes in strategy would be appropriate
Created portfolio summary reports for high net worth clients and presented findings to investment advisors.
Madre – International Women’s Human Rights Organization New York, NY
Accounting Intern
Recorded and paid invoices via Fund EZ non-profit accounting software and created P&L reports.
Provided reliable and timely project by project expense, capitalization and spend data for all departments.
Saved costs by pro-actively searching for and purchasing new office equipment and re-negotiating lease contracts.

Assisted with advisement of new freshmen during the registration process. ·
Facilitated campus tours for new freshmen and their families.

text.b: Ernst & Young Forensic Accounting Case Competition

page.text: Worked as part of four person team to analyze and detect fraud in financial statements.
